question.title: How to start Quarkus application with maven
question.body: I am trying to run Quarkus application. I have about 20 separate Quarkus applications and each one is built as a JAR file using Maven. I'm trying to figure out the best way to run all of them locally at the same time on my machine. What would be the most efficient and manageable way to start all 20 applications locally?

answers.body:
There a many ways you can use a process manager,docker or kubernetes...

  • Process manager(Foreman):
    You can use it to run multiple process via a single config file:
service-a: java -jar service-a.jar
service-b: java -jar service-b.jar

They is also pm2 it's for nodejs but it works with any command and you can also monitor the processes

  • Docker compose:

    You Wrap each JAR file in a lightweight docker image and use docker-compose.yaml to define the services

  • Kubernetes

    You will have to create a deployment.yaml for each JAR application

The first approach is the easiest and fastest one it's also manageable to some extent.
